verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> shadowing <S%H6767><s%> with wings <S%H3671><s%>, which is beyond <S%H5676><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%> of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%>:

That sends <S%H7971><s%> ambassadors <S%H6735><s%> by the sea <S%H3220><s%>, even in vessels <S%H3627><s%> of bulrushes <S%H1573><s%> upon <S%H6440><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%>, saying <S%H3212><s%>, Go, you swift <S%H7031><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%>, to a nation <S%H1471><s%> scattered <S%H4900><s%> and peeled <S%H4178><s%>, to a people <S%H5971><s%> terrible <S%H3372><s%> from their beginning until now <S%H1973><s%>; a nation <S%H1471><s%> measured out <S%H6978><s%> and trodden down <S%H4001><s%>, whose land <S%H776><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%> have spoiled <S%H958><s%>!

All you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the world <S%H8398><s%>, and dwellers <S%H7931><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%>, see <S%H7200><s%> you <S%H5375><s%>, when he lifts up a ensign <S%H5251><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%>; and when he blows <S%H8628><s%> a trumpet <S%H7782><s%>, hear you <S%H8085><s%>.

For so <S%H3541><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H8252><s%>, I will take my rest, and I will consider <S%H5027><s%> in my living place <S%H4349><s%> like a clear <S%H6703><s%> heat <S%H2527><s%> upon herbs <S%H216><s%>, and like a cloud <S%H5645><s%> of dew <S%H2919><s%> in the heat <S%H2527><s%> of harvest <S%H7105><s%>.

For before <S%H6440><s%> the harvest <S%H7105><s%>, when the bud <S%H6525><s%> is perfect <S%H8552><s%>, and the sour grape <S%H1155><s%> is ripening <S%H1580><s%> in the flower <S%H5328><s%>, he shall both cut off <S%H3772><s%> the sprigs <S%H2150><s%> with pruning hooks <S%H4211><s%>, and take away <S%H5493><s%> and cut down <S%H8456><s%> the branches <S%H5189><s%>.

They shall be left <S%H5800><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> unto the birds <S%H5861><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and to the animals <S%H929><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>: and the birds <S%H5861><s%> shall summer <S%H6972><s%> upon them <S%H929><s%>, and all the animals of the earth <S%H776><s%> shall winter upon them <S%H2778><s%>.

In that time <S%H6256><s%> shall the present <S%H7862><s%> be brought <S%H2986><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> of a people <S%H5971><s%> scattered <S%H4900><s%> and peeled <S%H4178><s%>, and from a people <S%H5971><s%> terrible <S%H3372><s%> from their beginning until now <S%H1973><s%>; a nation <S%H1471><s%> measured out <S%H6978><s%> and trodden under foot <S%H4001><s%>, whose land <S%H776><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%> have spoiled <S%H958><s%>, to the place <S%H4725><s%> of the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, the mountain <S%H2022><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%>.
